flawed_nl_solution:
Luke started putting together, 1000 x 0.1 = <<1000*0.1=100>>100 pieces.
The next day, there were 1000-100 = <<1000-100=900>>900 pieces left.
Then he put together 900 * 0.2 = <<900*0.2=180>>180 pieces on the second day.
So there were 900 - 180 = <<900-180=270>>270 pieces left.
On the third day, he put together 270 * 0.3 = <<270*0.3=81>>81 pieces.
Therefore, Luke still has 270 - 81 = <<270-81=189>>189 pieces left to complete the puzzle.
#### 189

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 720, not 270. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
